title: Does Deezer pay artists better than Spotify? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, or at least not by much. However, Deezer is experimenting with a different payment scheme than Spotify (and other major services.) Typically revenue is divided up by stream, which tends to send more of the money to top 40 acts as kids with lots of free time and background listeners spam the top hits playlists heavily. However, Deezer is now dividing up each subscriber’s payment by their listening. Busy but listen to your favorite death metal band a few times a month? They get your entire subscription fee! This model has potential to spread the growing streaming wealth around much better than the existing one. Unfortunately, it’s entirely transparent to the consumer so it’s unlikely to provide Deezer with any kind of competitive edge.

Although I’m not an artist, I am a deep fan of music and support talented artists and their music. However, speaking as a blogger, the discussion of how much each streaming service pays serves no purpose. What some of the whinny artists who are against streaming don’t understand is, streaming exist because people can no longer afford music anymore. You must understand, if it were not for the streaming services, you’d be making nothing, because more than half of streaming users would be pirating their music. And don’t get me started with YouTube. They keep bullying Spotify, yet, YouTube pays no royalties. YouTube is nothing but one big ass Pirate Bay. Makes no different that you can monetize or not. The content uploaded is still technical illegal. That should be a huge indication to you guys that PEOPLE ARE NOT BUYING MUSIC ANYMORE!!! Except maybe for people over 40 years of age. And not even then…….

Deezer doesn't pay too much less than Spotify. Where Spotify pays $0.0011 to artists, Deezer pays $0.0010. Honestly, comparing the streaming sites is not exactly apples to apples. For example, Tidal pays its artists more per play than Spotify ($.0070), but it has far fewer users (1 million), so an artist would need to rely on a larger percentage of a smaller pool of users to play their track. This analogy holds true for Deezer (6.9 million).

Deezer is a bunch of crooks. Even when they send streaming audits that clearly show they streamed the content, they don’t pay for the streams. Stick with spotify and other platofrms. At least they payout even if the pay-out-per-stream is low.

Yes, in short they do pay better. If you’re an artist getting < 10,000 streams than you’re really not going to see much of a difference but at scale the difference in payment does matter which makes Deezer better. I made a video which talks about this in a little more detail, you can watch here:
